title: Jazz Anthology Legendary Performers 3CD Set 1999 [flac]
description:
Jazz Anthology Featuring Over 50 Legendary Performers 3CD Set (1999, Prism)
 <a href="
http://www.discogs.com/Various-Jazz-Anthology/release/3554663" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.discogs.com/Various-Jazz-Anthology/release/3554663</a>

CD1 Take Five

This disc features some of the most important Jazzmen of the post war era from Be-Bop pioneers Dexter Gordon and Sonny Stitt to today's Wynton Marsalis.

1-01. Dave Brubeck - Take 5
1-02. Gerry Mulligan - Blight Of The Fumble Bee
1-03. Charles Mingus - Fables Of Faubus
1-04. Thelonious Monk - Off Minor
1-05. Art Blakey's Jazz Messengers - Moanin'
1-06. McCoy Tyner - You Taught My Heart To Sing
1-07. Chick Corea with the Oliver Jackson Orchestra - Moments Notice
1-08. Dexter Gordon - I Should Care
1-09. Wynton Marsalis - Wheel Within A Wheel
1-10. Sonny Stitt - Sonny's Blues
1-11. Gary Burton - African Flower
1-12. Sonny Rollins - Ev'ry Time We Say Goodbye
1-13. Stan Getz - Heartplace

CD2 All Through the Night

This disc highlights some of the Jazzmen of the Golden Age, like Earl Hines, Teddy Wilson, Lionel Hampton, and Gene Kupa, active in the Thirties, who went on to play an important part in the post-war era.

2-01. Earl Hines - Rosetta
2-02. Jimmy Hamilton - Don't Get Around Much Anymore
2-03. Teddy Wilson - Liza
2-04. Stephane Grappelli - Have You Met Miss Jones
2-05. Woody Herman - Rose Room
2-06. Kai Winding - Never Let Me Go
2-07. Johnny Griffin - All Through The Night
2-08. Buddy Rich - I'll Never Be The Same
2-09. Phil Woods - Caravan
2-10. Jimmy Hamilton - Satin Doll
2-11. Eddie 'Lockjaw' Davis - I Can't Get Started
2-12. Coleman Hawkins, J.J. Johnson and Lionel Hampton - Stardust
2-13. Dave Brubeck - Blue Rondo A La Turk
2-14. Ahmed Jamal - It's The Good Life
2-15. Lionel Hampton with the Oliver Jackson Orchestra - Airmail Special

CD3 Milestones

The mid-forties Be-Bop rebellion against the (mostly) white leaders of the Big Band era showcased the technical and harmonic sophistication of guys like Charlie Parker, Dizzy Gillespie and Bud Powell.

3-01. Buddy Rich and his Orchestra - Quiet Riot
3-02. Gene Krupa and his Orchestra - How High The Moon
3-03. Woody Herman and his Orchestra - Four Brothers ft. Zoot Sims, Stan Getz, Herbie Steward and Serge Chaloff
3-04. Dizzy Gillespie and his Orchestra - Algo Bueno (Woody 'N' You)
3-05. Miles Davis All Stars - Milestones ft. Charlie Parker 
3-06. Lennie Tristano Trio - On A Planet
3-07. Ray Brown's Bebop Boys - Moody Speaks ft. Dizzy Gillespie, James Moody 
3-08. Bud Powell with the Bebop Boys - Bebop In Pastel ft. Kenny Clark, Kenny Dorham, Sonny Stitt 
3-09. Don Byas Quartet - Danny Boy
3-10. Erroll Garner Trio - Laura
3-11. Ben Webster Quartet - Blue Skies
3-12. Stan Hasselgard Sextet - Swedish Pastry ft. Barney Kessel, Red Norvo 
3-13. Art Tatum Trio - I Got Rhythm
3-14. Lester Young and his Band - These Foolish Things
3-15. Charlie Parker Quartet - The Bird ft. Shelly Manne 
3-16. Tadd Dameron Sextet - Dameronia ft. Fats Navarro 
3-17. Dexter Gordon. Wardell Gray Quintet - The Chase
3-18. Charlie Shavers' All American Five - Ela Salon De Gutbucket
3-19. Leo Parker Sextet - Leaping Leo ft. Gene Ammons, Howard McGhee 
3-20. Lester Young and his Band - She's Funny That Way
3-21. Stan Getz Quartet - Opus De Bop
3-22. Johnny Hodges and his Orchestra - Day DBaNcMaAfIream
3-23. Kenny Clarke and his 52th Street Boys - Royal Roost ft. Bud Powell, Fats Navarro
